title: Zinedine Zidane's son Luca insists 'I do not regret leaving Real Madrid'
text:
Luca Zidane insists he is happy with his decision to join Racing Santander on loan in the summer despite seemingly missing out on playing time at Real Madrid.

Zidane signed for the Spanish second-tier club in search of first-team football but Madrid No 1 Thibaut Courtois missed out last time out against Granada due to illness.

The son of manager Zinedine Zidane has made two previous appearances for Real and at 21 years old could have been in line to stand in for the former Chelsea stopper.

Luca Zidane has no regrets over joining Racing Santander on loan from Real Madrid

Fellow goalkeepers including Keylor Navas and Andriy Lunin also left the club over the summer, paving the way for Alphonse Areola to join from Paris Saint-Germain. He has since stepped in to replace Courtois.

Courtois has not featured since being replaced at half-time in Madrid's surprise 2-2 draw with Club Brugge in the Champions League, although Zidane insists he has no regrets over the move away from the Spanish capital.

'I am very happy to be in this great club because people have received me very well. It has been a big change, but I feel very good,' he told Diario AS.

The No 1 spot appears up for grabs at Real Madrid following Thibaut Courtois's substitution at half-time in their surprise 2-2 draw with Club Brugge in the Champions League

Including his son Luca, Zinedine Zidane allowed three keepers to leave Madrid in the summer

'I do not regret having left Real Madrid. I know it was an important step and I wanted to take it because I needed to be in a professional team, to be playing and prove my worth.

'What can happen in a few years remains to be seen. I understand that it is normal to ask me about Real Madrid, but not I'm going to answer.'

Zinedine Zidane also has three other sons looking to make their mark on the game. The eldest at 24, Enzo, is a midfielder at Portuguese top-flight side Aves after failing to make the breakthrough at the Bernabeu.

But his other two sons are looking to make their mark at Madrid. Theo is also a midfielder and playing in their Under-19 team, while youngest Elyaz is a left-back currently in the youth set-up at the club.
description: Luca Zidane insists he is happy with this decision to join Racing Santander on loan in the summer despite seemingly missing out on playing time at Real Madrid.
